comments.creator: bugzilla@game-point.net
comments.raw_text: According to Neil Deakin in bug #384410, comment 7, the XUL 'onselect' event should only fire (when it's set on a radiogroup element) if the radio button selected in that group has actually changed.  At the moment, it fires even if the user clicks on the radio button in the group that is already selected, which would seem to be incorrect behaviour.  It should not fire in this circumstance.
